Posts.Content: I see a lot of folks getting 3T MRI. Is that similar are the same as mpMRI with endorectal coil? Which is better?

Same as last time PIRADS 3 lesion in the right posterolateral peripheral zone. Similar size.

Posts.Content: I would assume if your PSA comes back a little higher then they would like you would be offered radiation. A friend of mine had RALP and his PSA came back.16 and he got a few weeks of radiation. It went down to .10 after radiation and probably will keep going down for months.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Consultant33 It is very strange that your doctor didn't order a Free PSA test already. If you do this you will eliminate significantly the possibility of cancer, I also think based on my experience that cancer is highly unlikely for your case. They did it was .53ngml
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA at 37 years old

Posts.Content: Hi all. I am new to the forum and been reading tons of posts which I find helpful. In 2016 I was starting to have some dribbling and slow stream issues. PSA was taken and antibiotics given for prostatitis. PSA 1.6 meds didnt work. I was then referred to urologist who didn't suspect prostate issues and put me through the ringer with bladder void tests, sonograms urodynamics testing and cystoscopy. Found high bladder neck and recommend surgey if I wanted to release pressure. I declined as I could live with the issue and was suspicious. I used to pee like a race horse as a kid. Did another PSA later in 2016 (7 months later which came back 1.9). He said to keep eye on this and follow up 6 months later in 2017. After being put through the ringer by this one doctor and spending close to 5k on all these tests I changed doctors. Anyway, I just got my PSA take and it is now 4.9. Dr ordered biopsy for 2 weeks. Originally said it could wait till November.... until I pressed him harder saying I need this to be the up most priority. Additionally, they did a urine analysis and rectum swab (not sure why). The new Dr does not seemed concerned at all and that bothers me. He said PSA going up that high and fast is typically not a symptom of cancer but rather inflammation. I also did research last night showing that persons under 40 are at about 1% chance getting prostate cancer. No prostate cancer in my family ever. Should I be concerned or be cool like this Dr? Thank you.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA at 37 years old

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Consultant33 It is very strange that your doctor didn't order a Free PSA test already. If you do this you will eliminate significantly the possibility of cancer, I also think based on my experience that cancer is highly unlikely for your case. They did it was .53ngml

Posts.Content: I just did one last week. It was piece of cake. They gave me a valium and there was no real pain. I had some gas and bleeding for a week or so. I thought the fusion biopsy was easier and less worse the the MRI. you will do fine. Just expect blood right after the procedure and may be a lot...they will give you towels to wipe away the mess.

Posts.Title: Fusion Biopsy Fear (Big Baby?)

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by PCASpouse I posted separately, as a newbie spouse of my 57-year-old husband, that he is finally scheduled for MRI guided fusion bx with US 3/29 on his 2.6 cm x 1.4 in maximum length mass, depsite size, oddly read as PiRADS 4. I want to line up a new expert urologist for detailed consultation, to see him just as soon as I will have bx results ( do not want the current guy to do the actual surgery, if that is needed, because of poor office communication and several hostile or confused personnel). I will be asking for genetic markers. What is your experience on how long you waited for bx results? Two days, a week, two weeks? Appointments with good people are hard to get in my urban area so I should probably not waste their time showing up without a biopsy report, but do not want much delay. Unfortunately the current urologist is n/a to communicate about this and his office manager clerk does not know or care to find out. Or should I just schedule now for next open even if the biopsy is not done or ready, because such a lesion is almost certainly going to be CA of one type or another? It only took two days for me to get my breast cancer biopsy report, and the next week I met with an off-plan surgeon, but easily available prostate CA docs who are good are harder to find short notice. Thanks in advance. 14 business days max.
